subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat
Engage the steering wheel to turn the vehicle
Use pedals to control speed and direction
Operate the steering levers for precision movements
Check rearview mirrors for visibility
Adjust the seating position for comfort and control
Approach the haystack with a forklift attachment
Securely position the hay using the forklift tines
Drive the cart to the desired location
Alight from the tractor and direct the cart using foot pedals
Position the cart beneath the haydrop
Use the cart handles to guide the hay into the cart
Repeat the process until the cart is sufficiently loaded

tasks.task: Unload hay from a cart onto a hay barn
subtasks: Drive the cart into position under the hay barn door
Ensure the cart is properly aligned with the barn entrance
Disengage the forklift attachment if needed
Lift the hay using the forklift or manual labor
Transport the hay into the barn
Stack the hay in designated areas for storage
Secure the hay to prevent it from shifting
Assemble the planter on the tractor
Align the planter with the furrows
Operate the planter to plant the corn seeds at the correct depth
Monitor the planting speed and spacing
Make adjustments to the planter settings as needed
Repeat the process across the field
Position the combine in the field
Set the combine to the appropriate corn harvesting settings
Operate the combine to cut and thresh the corn
Watch the combine's grain tank level and adjust as necessary
Drive the combine to a designated storage area
Offload the harvested corn into storage bins
Attach the fertilizer spreader to the tractor
Set the spreader to the correct application rate
Operate the tractor to distribute the fertilizer evenly over the field
Check for coverage and adjust the spreader if needed
Refill the spreader and repeat until the entire field is treated
Prepare the seeder for alfalfa planting
Secure the seeder on the tractor
Start the planting process, monitoring depth and spacing
Ensure uniform planting across the field
Continue until the desired area is planted
Position the swather in the alfalfa field
Set the cutting height and width
Drive the swather through the field, cutting the alfalfa
Allow the swath to dry appropriately
Collect the cut alfalfa if using a pickup attachment
Connect the pickup attachment to the swather
Guide the wagon under a freshly cut swath
Use a rake or hay tool to load the alfalfa into the wagon
Secure the load to prevent shifting during transport

tasks.task: Transfer alfalfa from a wagon to a storage facility
subtasks: Drive the wagon to the storage shed or barn
Unload the alfalfa, ensuring proper stacking for dryness and freshness
Cover the stored alfalfa to protect from rain or other elements
